Friendly rivalry?
 




Tony Parker, Gregg Popovich are back in the Finals.  (Getty Images)



      There are several longstanding bonds between the coaching staffs and 
      front offices for the Spurs and Cavaliers. Tony Mejia says the 
      respect and affection will be forgotten when Game 1 tips. Full 
      story |  Mejia's 
      Preview
 Related Links:• Doyel: Cavs won't last | Series | Matchups | Cavs' history | Spurs prep• Bracket | Reflections | Speak! CLE | SA | Highlights:  Cavs | Spurs


 


 

 





 Weekend Buzz: Testing you on the Cubbies' futility


    

      Dugout brawl. Errors. Add Lou 
      Piniella's epic dirt-kicking tantrum and you've got a very bad week for 
      the Cubs. The ineptitude is enough for a pop quiz, Scott Miller 
      says.
    

  
• Piniella suspended | Cubs clobber Braves | Blog | Yo!


 

 





 Ducks GM Burke cries foul over unchecked behavior


    

      
      Chris Pronger 
      gets a one-game ban, but Anaheim brass thinks a hit by the Sens' Chris 
      Neil was equally wrong. Wes Goldstein says shifting the focus 
      won't change facts.
    

  
• Pronger benched for Game 4 | Finals: ANA 2, OTT 1
